Section 5] SAP BTP General

SAP Business Technology Platform BTP is a massive Platform, and in my opinion will be bigger and more important than the S/4HANA for SAP Customers in the future. The BTP is a technology enabler containing all kinds of capabilities.

Here is the SAP BTP Strategy WhitePaper for 2025 onwards SAP Business Technology Platform: The Innovation Engine for Your SAP Applications

The first thing I am going to comment on, since this is a 1 Pager for SAP Technology Architects is the Technical Architecture of the BTP.

Ok, but first, we need to include this one...

SAP Business Technology Platform: The Innovation Engine for Your SAP Applications - strategy 2025

SAP Business Technology Platform: The Innovation Engine for Your SAP Applications

The BTP is extremely rich and flexible in how it can be set up and configured, and this can be a good thing and a bad thing, the biggest challenge is, making foundation layer mistakes which cost time and money to correct in the future.

For me to try show how complex the BTP is, we will first look at SAP's Future Ready Enterprise Framework, this is an approach to modularising maturity with the BTP and leading the Customer on a journey to BTP Architecture Excellence.

You've heard of a SAP Customer Center of Excellence, there is now a concept of SAP BTP Center of Excellence, this shows how complex and rich this subject is.

There is a beautiful publicly available presentation here  on the Future Ready Enterprise and the SAP BTP Future Ready Enterprise Unlock and Maximize the value of BTP

With wonderful slides like these...

You don't necessarily need to engage SAP's Services on this, at least by studying and digesting the picture you can think about how those dimensions apply to your Organisation and fill in the boxes in terms of the objectives and vision of your Organisation

These slides are a humbling reminder of how vast the BTP is, and how getting a decent maturity level in the BTP will help your Organisation achieve its goals

So now we know, the BTP is big, and it's complex, and it needs proper planning and architecting if we are going to get the most from it.

For  the first few years the SAP Cloud Platform was mainly SAP Cloud Platform Integration and a lot of people slipped in to a bad habit of associating the BTP with Integration capability, we it's a lot more than that and we all need to appreciate that.

The following document is another useful introduction to the SAP Future Ready Enterprise Framework:

Presentation Title

The following picture is here to show us just how complex the BTP is, and let us all reflect on where our Company's maturity level is with the BTP:

Just spend some time to study that table and think about where your Organisation's maturity level is and whether or not it would be a good investment to buy some BTP Training and Services from SAP. I am not trying to sell Services here, but I have learned the hard way that an investment in knowledge can save significant amounts in the future.

This picture which is from the same deck is to really show us what a journey BTP maturity is...

There is a very nice blog by @Pedro_Souza169  on the same subject here The Future-Ready Enterprise: A Framework for SAP B... - SAP Community

SAP BTP Data Management in a Nutshell Title Goes Here and Here and Here

Then read the section Setting up your Account Model Setting Up Your Account Model | SAP Help Portal

The biggest lesson I can bring is, when architecting the BTP from a clean sheet of paper, one of the most important foundation steps is to correctly design the Stages / Directories / Sub-Accounts and Entitlements, the setting up of the Account Model, get this wrong and you will pay for it later.

BTP Domains / Stages / Directories / Sub-Accounts

Domain refers to the Capability, eg Cloud Integration, Work Zone, Build Process Automation

Stages refers to the type of environment, eg Dev, Test, Quality, UAT, Prod

Directory refers to the structuring elements for Sub-Accounts

Sub-Account let's you further structure according to your requirements

My recomendation is go for an Account Model with Directories and Sub-Accounts Account Model With Directories and Subaccounts | SAP Help Portal

Account Model | SAP Help Portal

The reason for this is:

You then have the possibility for all kinds of template BTP layouts according to the demands of your Organisation and at the same time you can leverage all of the benefits described above

And then as already described you profit from being able to leverage Authorisation and Entitlement features per Directory / BTP Domain

Setting Up Your Account Model | SAP Help Portal

To recap setting up the Account Model is probably the most important BTP Technical Architecture decision !

Section 5.1] SAP CALM Cloud Application LifeCycle Management

[We must all remember, CALM in many cases is the successor of SAP Solution Manager (SolMan), and SAP Cloud ALM Application Lifecycle Management will replace SolMan for many of the capabilities, but not all !]

In my opinion of the SAP world, it's fair to say that CALM is a new(er) product, and it is a fact that it is evolving, and the capabilities are evolving according to SAP's RoadMap and Vision for CALM.

Everybody needs to keep in mind, that CALM is not a 1 to 1 replacement of SolMan, and even the planned capabilities of CALM are not yet all in place, but, according to SAP they will be.

CALM is going to be the center or our universe, we will be "doing" the whole Program/Operation from CALM, from what I hear SAP has hundreds of programmers working on CALM, the following presentation is a great way to open this section and give a view of what CALM is in 2024 and where CALM is going....  

SAP CALM for Implementation  - What's new 2024

Presentation Title

In this section there is a lot of very useful documentation, and including one which shows the comparison between CALM and SolMan, and for SAP Technology Architects who are looking at the capabilities of As-Is technologies and looking at the To-Be architecture and required capabilities and making the transformation roadmap, this is something which is very important to know.

CALM is a lot more, but for the basics, Monitoring, Transporting, Alerting, read on and explore the documentation....

SAP Solution Manager SolMan to SAP Cloud ALM CALM Transition Center in SAP for Me Portal, this is your starting point for how to transition from SolMan to CALM, this page includes the feature scope comparison between SolMan and CALM

Section 5.3] AI & Intelligent Technologies

For me, AI and Automation and Intelligent Technologies are one of the biggest opportunities for improvements in efficiency across the whole Enterprise, across technical operation business. 

All of us have an obligation to stay ahead of the game here and know about the available products and the roadmaps and where the integration of AI and Automation and in fact Analytics into Business Processes can improve efficiency and decision making across the Organisation end to end. We need to know what is currently available and possible and what the roadmaps and plans for the future are. There are already a lot of easy win easy to implement SAP AI enabled capabilities, from SAP Build Code AI to Intelligent Account Reconciliation and everything in between.

This section will combine AI and Automation together.

Section 6] SAP North Star Architecture and Customer Center of Excellence

(This section is a work in progress)

You might be asking yourself why in a SAP RISE Toolbox there are links to how to do a SAP CCOE ?

That's a great question, and the answer is that, most companies have been running/operating SAP the same way since 3.1h, and now with RISE the whole game is changing, the Roles and Responsibilities are changing and the Segregation of Duties is changing, between who does what, SAP, Customer, and if they have one the Customer's System Integrator. 

And that's why, during the S/4HANA RISE Transformation, you will be best off, if you take the opportunity and redesign how you run/operate SAP, the way you have run SAP for the ECC generation will not fit to how you run SAP in the RISE generation, and on top of this, isn't it time for "The Business" and "IT/SAP" to get closer together ?

This will help with setting the scene.. SAP Learning Journey...

Discover Organizational Change Management for SAP Cloud Projects

S4H_632 OCM Customer Organisation Readiness Whitepaper.pdf

SAP offer a fantastic service for helping Customers on this journey, S/4HANA & RISE is not only an ERP Transformation, it's also an Organisational Transformation, and you should look at the SAP North Star Architecture Services, in my 25 years of doing SAP these are the most valuable Services I have seen as North Star Architectures brings the knowledge of all of SAP's Customers and Best Practices on how to run SAP. 

In my opinion, if you have the money, then the North Star Architecture Service is a must have for helping ensure the success of the S/4HANA & RISE journey, from conception to delivery.

There was an amazing SAP North Star Architecture public event in December (2024) and the material is here, the presentation and the video recording:

Section 7] Lessons Learned

(this section is an ongoing work in progress)

How to Avoid Delays in an S/4HANA Program

I am leading with this one, as in my opinion it is the most important and the mechanisms for avoiding delays drill down in to other areas.

Delays in the S/4 Programs can run into costs of millions per month, according to the cash burn rate of the Program. There are ways to avoid and reduce the chance of delays, and that's what we're going to discuss here.

Currently on my second S/4 Program and looking forward to the third one, this has given me a deep understanding of the "procedure", and the activities, and what works and what doesn't and enables reflection how to avoid problems, and the biggest problem in my opinion is DELAYS to the Program. The S/4 Program is huge, and it is very expensive, and has a hugely expensive monthly burn rate, and delays in the S/4 Program have at least two painful impacts, the first one is the monthly extended cash burn rate, and the second is the delaying of other Programs and Projects which are dependent on the on time success of the S/4 Program and it's Releases.

In my experience, Delays will become visible in SIT and UAT, this is where things will happen which will result in Delays. 

That does not mean that SIT and UAT are the cause of the Delays, it means the gaps / weaknesses become exposed during SIT and UAT, which actually is the purpose of SIT and UAT.

The problem is that in SIT and UAT, I see the same pattern, Defects and even Design Changes are being exposed which could have, and should have become visible earlier, which means the prior phases were not executed properly.

The problem is, an S/4 Program is not a SAP Migration or Upgrade or Transformation in the classical sense, it is a Data Transformation, a Process Transformation, a Technical Basis Transformation, an Integration Transformation, a User Experience Transformation, an Operations Transformation, a User Interface Transformation, a Security Transformation.

Invest in Training, Education, and Preparation

Training  -  make sure everybody has as much training as possible and is on the same page

Skills  - this document is an oldy, and a goody, from 2016 and goes through the 10 SAP Quality Principles, Driving Excellence in Implementations - and Beyond: The Underlying Quality Principles and one of the principles is: 

Training and Education :

Get the Team to do the RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition learning journey...

Discovering RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, premium plus Implementation and Adoption

Send as many people as you can afford on the following training, this training is GOLDEN.

Regardless of what you think about methodologies, Activate is a Guided Procedure across all dimensions of the S/4 Program, which SAP have developed and evolved with continuous lessons from Customer experiences and will guide you through the journey you are about to embark on, your people need to have done these training courses:

ACT1CL_EN_Col11 SAP Activate Methodology Introduction

ACT2CL_EN_Col11 SAP Activate Methodology Cloud Implementation

ACT5CL_EN_Col12 Introduction to SAP Activate Methodology for SAP Cloud Implementations

ACT100.21.EN-US SAP Activate Methodology

S4C03_EN_Col21 RISE with S4HANA Cloud Private Edition Onboarding Fundamentals

Program / Project Management

Get the Leadership Team to prepare the plan and ideally have SAP sanity check it by using North Star Services, pay for a Service from SAP for them to sanity check the S/4HANA Program Plan

 
Clean Core and Cloud Mindset, before the Program, get everybody trained in these approaches
 
Embrace the Proactive Maintenance & Contractual Maintenance Periods CMP
 
 
RISE Leadership Guide  - Everybody should read this https://www.sap.com/documents/2019/05/44b3ebd5-4b7d-0010-87a3-c30de2ffd8ff.html
 
S/4HANA Upgrades
 
Upgrades are recommended be done in a Project Dual Line Landscape - period
 
Releases and Upgrades should be clubbed together where possible
 
This will then...
 
Protect Production 
 
Protect the Program 
 
In anything you do, you must Protect Production and you must Protect the Program !
 
Program Team
 
Have a dedicated Team, don't have Operations People working on the S/4 Transformation part time as that can be a contributor to delays in the Program, and a Program wide delay of only 1 month will cover the cost of dedicated people
 
Other Non-SAP Teams in your Organisation
 
If the Program is depending on deliveries from other Non-SAP Teams in the Organisations, eg there will need to be a custom development on Service-Now or SalesForce or whatever other system then you need to make sure that those Teams have people/resource capacity, it has happened  that the whole S/4 Transformation Program is delayed in one of the Releases because of  Resource Capacity in a totally different Team which wasn't foreseen in the planning
 
Stick to the Plan 
 
Protect Production 
 
Protect the Program
 
If the Program is working and everything is going well, don't start trying to cut costs
 
FUE's
 
It is extremely important to take care of how you classify your Users, all Users, Dialog and System/Technical, because if you don't classify a User then that User will be measured as Advanced and charged accordingly.
 
Rotating Keys
 
TLS Certificiates
 
When you Rotate Keys in S/4HANA make sure that all dependent systems have the new keys, eg MBC Multi Bank Connectivity has the S/4HANA certificate and you need to update it there too

Don't skip "Phase 0", plan to give Phase Zero the time it needs

Key Users

Key Users are one of the keys to a successful GoLive make sure they are trained and have all of the support they need

 
Key Users are your Ambassadors, make sure they have everything they need
 
Investment and Multi-Year Multiple Release/GoLive Transformations
 
Everything is relative, whatever you can afford, make sure to invest in the success of the first GoLive/Release,do not cut costs or corners on the first GoLive/Release, the first GoLive/Release MUST be a SUCCESS.
 
Subsequent GoLives/Releases will in general be a rinse and repeat of the template for how
the first GoLive/Release was executed and you can reduce costs on those GoLives/Releases
 
S/4 Data Transformation and Integration
 
We need to do Mapping and Transformations of Data, either at the SAP End or the other End - this is another challenge to the "Clean-Core" and the S/4 Transformations, there needs to be a principle, mappings/transformation must happen outside of the S/4
 
Technical GoLive should be separated / disconnected from the Business GoLive
 
Technical GoLive several months before Business GoLive
 
In your Release Planning, disconnect the Technical GoLives from the Business GoLives, separate the two, run the Technical GoLives a couple of months ahead of the Business GoLives, do not combine the Technical and Business GoLives 

RISE Proactive Maintenance for S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Contractual Maintenance Periods

SAP and Customer agree regular periods where there can be downtimes for SAP to do Maintenance

Plan this in your Release Planning

S/4HANA Upgrades

In your multi-year Release Plan, make room for S/4HANA Upgrades to enable you to benefit from the latest SAP innovations

Capacity

You need to care for your Capacity and Data Volume Management

Basis Projects and Operations

You need to re-design your Project Basis Team and Operations Basis Team and methods of working according to the segregation of duties with the RISE ECS Team

Run SGEN straight after systems are delivered and before GoLives

Performance Tuning & House Keeping  - that's your job

FUE Licensing Costs and SAP Roles and Authorisations

SAP RISE S/4HANA usage is measured and sized in what’s called FUE’s, Full Usage Equivalents​, pay attention to this

SAP RISE AntiVirus

VSI is a extra service, not mandatory as of today

EWA Report

Pay very close to attention to it, it will become one of your best friends

S/4HANA FailOver and DR

Understand what you really get with 99.7 and 99.9 regarding Availability Zones and Regions

S/4HANA Preparation

Before installation, specify all Security Requirements and get them included in the installation and post installation

RISE is about Segregation of Duties on the Basis Team

RISE is about running Basis as a Factory with clear Roles and Responsibilities and Methods or Working

RISE is about Proper Planning an Preparation

Basis Trial and Error way of working evolves to Planning and Preparation way of working

 
Service Requests
 
Quality
 
Right First Time
 
SAP do not quality control Service Requests
 
Learn the Templates
 
RISE Technical Architecture
 
Is not the same as OnPremise
 
A RISE LoadBalancer or Application Gateway, does not necessarily work the same way on RISE as it does in your own DataCenter/HyperScaler even if they are the same
 
The SAP RISE Architecture View
 
Get from SAP as much technical architecture views of the RISE "Customer Setup" as possible
 
SAP Technical Architects are the an integral part of the new Basis Team
 
Basis Team benefits from being experienced and disciplined 
 
RISE Architect from SAP
 
Get a SAP RISE Architect from SAP onboarded to the project from the beginning

SAP CALM is your new best friend

Sizing and Performance Testing better in than out

Trust and Verify

There are very useful RISE lessons learned here from @shaji_narayanan 

Lessons Learned from SAP ERP Conversion to RISE wi... - SAP Community

Here is an excellent blog detailing the engine room lessons learned in a SAP S/4HANA RISE Migration with DMO by @savithakumar thank you...

SAP RISE - Key Learnings - SAP Community

And most of all, enjoy the RISE Journey 🛫

Andy Silvey.

SAP Technology Architect [Contractor]

Author Bio:

Andy Silvey is a 26 years SAP Technology veteran [15 years SAP Basis and 11 years SAP Tech Arch including Tech, Integration, Security, Data from 3.1H to S/4HANA PCE on RISE and the BTP and everything in between, and former SCN Moderator and Mentor alumni].

entry.title: Introducing Warehousing Concept in SAP S/4 HANA Supply Chain Execution
entry.content:
Hi All

I am explaining warehousing in Supply Chain Execution in SAP S/4 Hana

Brief Overview to SAP S/4 Hana and Features

With SAP S/4HANA, SAP is providing a product that represents the next generation of business applications. Simple enterprise software that is designed to help you run simple in the digital economy. SAP S/4HANA supports

Customer in dealing with challenges like integrating business data with data outside of our company and supporting our business processes with artificial intelligence (or AI). The SAP S/4HANA family is completely built on the in-memory platform SAP HANA. Using the potential of the SAP HANA platform, SAP S/4HANA is designed for customer digital business. It provides an instant insight into where your business currently stands. It does this by combining a single source of truth with dynamic planning and analysis capabilities and real-time process support.

With the SAP Fiori user experience and a less complex data model, SAP S/4HANA is designed to run simple. In parallel, it reduces the data footprint of your company.

 The SAP S/4HANA system is also already connected to business networks and company internal collaboration networks like SAP Build Work Zone. And it also prepares us for supporting your processes with SAP Business AI. All of these aspects protect your investment into SAP software by facilitating the next generation of business applications.

SAP S/4 Hana comes with following Product Versions

SAP S/4 Hana on premises

SAP S/4HANA On-Premises managed by SAP (HEC)

SAP S/4 Hana Public Edition

SAP S/4 Hana Private Edition

 

SAP S/4HANA contains the below elements

SAP S/4HANA Enterprise Management.

SAP S/4HANA Line-of-Business Products.

SAP S/4HANA Line-of-Business (LoB) Products for specific industries.

SAP S/4HANA Compatibility Packs.

Supply Chain Management Capability in S/4 Hana

 

SAP S/4HANA enables companies to integrate and visualize all supply chain processes from supplier to customer. Intelligence can also be embedded in these processes. Digital supply chain and mission-critical business processes are supported across the enterprise with one single source of live information such as

  • Reduce Days of Inventory
  • Reduction in Revenue Loss Due to Fulfilment Issues
  • Reduced Overall Supply Chain Planning Costs
  • Improved Supply Chain Planning, increasing Productivity
  • Reduced TCO Through Landscape Simplification

Digital Supply Chain Execution

The core functionality provided by SAP S/4HANA can be extended with other (sometimes Cloud based) SAP products, to support the complete logistics network of a company.

Additional SAP products that support the complete supply chain

SAP Global Batch Traceability

SAP AI Core

SAP Yard Logistics

SAP User Experience Strategy

The use of mobile devices (smart-phones and tablets) to perform certain work tasks, is no longer reserved to a special group of experts. Ease of use is a very important characteristic for the end user of such a device. The focus of the user interface (UI) of the device is no longer maximum functionality, but rather a comfortable user experience and thus a focus on the consumer of the device. With this in mind, the business software running behind the device must be adapted and transformed so that it supports the user interface (used within the business roles of an enterprise) to a maximum. In practice this means that SAP S/4HANA and SAP Fiori as its user interface go hand-in-hand, and should be developed hand-in-hand.

Different User Types — Different Requirements

SAP Fiori

SAP Fiori is a collection of apps, which is created based on a specific set of guidelines and rules and that can be started using the SAP Fiori launchpad.

Available Warehouse Management Solutions in SAP S/4 Hana

Warehouse Management LE-WM

The classic SAP ERP solution for warehouse management LE-WM is part of SAP S/4HANA through a Compatibility Package (CP). This provides customers with a limited use right which expires on December 31, 2027. The inclusion of LE-WM in SAP S/4HANA helps customers migrating from SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA to start using some of the advanced features of SAP S/4HANA without having to also immediately migrate their warehouse management solution at the same time. For existing customers that do not require complex warehouse processing in their SAP S/4HANA system, with release 1909 of SAP S/4HANA a basic warehouse management solution has been introduced in SAP S/4HANA called Stock Room Management.

Stock Room Management

The main reason for adding Stock Room Management to SAP S/4HANA is to give existing customers of LE-WM an opportunity to keep their existing LE-WM warehouses after 2027 that do not benefit immediately from moving to (embedded) SAP EWM. Stock Room Management is relevant for small warehouses with manual operations that manage stocks on storage bin level. this deployment allows customers to upgrade to SAP S/4HANA without performing a full-fledged WM transformation.

LE-WM features that are not supported in Stock Room Management include

  • Task and Resource Management (WM-TRM)
  • Warehouse Control Unit interface (WM-LSR)
  • Value Added Service (WM-VAS)
  • Yard Management (WM-YM)
  • Cross-Docking (WM-CD)
  • Wave Management (WM-TFM-CP)
  • Decentralized WM (WM-DWM)

SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM)

SAP EWM first emerged as a successor to SAP Logistics Execution Warehouse Management (LE-WM), with added advantages and advanced features such as material flow system (MFS) and Labor Management. The earliest versions of SAP EWM were only available as separate standalone applications until 2016 when SAP embedded the EWM functionality in the  SAP S/4 Hana Suite. SAP EWM can be installed as standalone or be connected to an SAP S/4HANA system.

The solution can be deployed as Embedded or Decentral. In both case for On Premise or running SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private Edition.

Embedded EWM in SAP S/4HANA

Embedded SAP EWM is also available. Embedded means that no separate system is required and therefore SAP EWM can be used as a direct replacement for LE-WM. EWM is in such a set-up completely embedded within the SAP S/4HANA system. By embedding EWM on SAP S/4HANA, clients could take advantage of the SAP HANA in-memory database  and execute high-speed transactions for their warehousing operations. With each new version of SAP S/4HANA, more functionality was added to embedded EWM, including an ever-growing list of innovative SAP Fiori apps and a stripped-down version called stock room management.

The license type differentiation for Basic or  Advanced is only applicable for embedded deployment cases.

To Choose Basic or Advanced Please customized under IMG-EWM-Master Data -Acknowledge Use of Advance Function

Basic Extended Warehouse Management

Basic license type, customers are able to perform the main process end to end such as, Inbound, Outbound, Production Integration, Quality management integration, etc. Below you can find all the process included on basic license:


Inventory Management 

Inbound Processing 

Outbound Processing 

Internal Warehouse Movements

Physical Inventory

Reporting (Warehouse Management Monitor, Analytics)

Resource Management

Quality Management

Production Integration

Integration with Transportation Management (ASR)

IDOC Integration to third-party MFS systems (SAP Note 2873423)

Advanced Extended Warehouse Management

 The advanced license might be required in case of customer would use some features enclosed of the main process, for example, the outbound process designed is required to use Wave management or, the production integration is required to use JIT - Just in Time. It means that the Advanced license type is required in case of use some specific SAP EWM features, such as

Material Flow System (MFS)

Wave Management

Transportation units

Yard Management

Labor Management

Cross Docking

Value Added Services (VAS)

Warehouse Billing

Kitting

Dock Appointment Scheduling (DAS)

Slotting

Cartonization planning

Distribution Equipment

JIT

WIP Tracking

Warehouse Zones for advanced interleaving

License Management for SAP EWM Embedded

 The list of the extended objects for SAP EWM embedded is technically found on table /SCWM/EXT_OBJ. SAP Product Solution Team provide 2 reports for customers perform in their system in order to know which objects is being used on their warehouse system with usage detail

  • Report /SCWM/RP_COMPLIANCE_CHECK is available since S/4HANA 2016 (and higher) and provides the information if the customizing or the licensing  is compliance or non-compliance for each warehouse system.
  • Report /SCWM/RP_LICENCE_SELF_AUDIT is available since S/4HANA 2022 (and higher) and provides by warehouse number a view by month of usage of Basic and Advanced features by total number of items per month, number of average items per day and active working days, compliance or non-compliance from the customizing perspective

 Decentralized EWM in SAP S/4HANA

After SAP launched embedded EWM in SAP S/4HANA 1610, there were a lot of customers who realized that they wanted to use their existing systems but also embedded EWM features in another SAP S/4HANA physical server. The reasoning was this would ensure higher performance levels and warehouse business process continuity in case of any downtime. To cater to such a requirement, SAP introduced a new deployment option known as decentralized EWM in SAP S/4HANA 1809, FPS 01. Prior to this version, embedded EWM used to share the same master data objects which were loaded as part of the same SAP S/4HANA instance and could not interact with the master data of other SAP ERP  or SAP S/4HANA instances.  With the new decentralized deployment, clients can take advantage of current and new innovations in embedded EWM but keep on using separate SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA core systems.

Note- The Decentralize deployment always requires the advanced license type

Types of SAP EWM Warehouses

 

Types of warehouses and their main tasks could be

Production Warehouse

  • Raw-materials handling
  • Integration of quality management
  • Production supply
  • Receipts from production
  • Materials staging and consumption

Distribution Center

  • Complex process and high volume
  • High degree of automation
  • Wave management
  • Slotting and rearrangement
  • Replenishment

Service Parts Warehouse 

  • Low to very high complexity
  • Kitting and value-added services
  • High volatility
  • Serial numbering
  • Heterogeneous product ranges

Cross-Dock or Transit Warehouse 

  • Regional hubs, gateways, and container freight stations
  • Air and ocean freight handling
  • Unit-load devices and containers handling
  • Receive from and sent to airport or seaport (drayage)

Conclusion- It will give a brief idea about the products and warehouse Management which will help to utilize knowledge to choose correct option for warehouse in Supply chain Management.

Reference https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blogs-by-sap/understanding-license-type-basic-vs-advanced-for-sap-extended-warehouse/ba-p/13580547

SAP Help 

Please provide the feed back to improve it

entry.title: Architecting Email Approval without My Inbox for SAP Build Process Automation Workflows: Part 3
entry.content:
This is the third and final blog of the series, in which we would like to explain the testing part in detail.

We have kept testing separate in this blog to provide a comprehensive explanation of all scenarios and steps from a technical perspective.

We have prepared the content for this series in three blogs, where we will be diving deep into Design, Development, and Testing.

  • Blog 1 – This blog will focus on the Business process, context, problem statement, end to end development flow, and required prerequisites.
  • Blog 2 This blog will focus on development and will provide a detailed walkthrough of the development process.
  • Blog 3(This blog) : This blog will focus on complete end-to-end testing, helping to understand the overall objective.

In the previous blog, @Adwait_Fadnavis  walked you through the complete development process. Now, I would like to start with the testing part.

Detailed Example of the Testing Process

To illustrate the testing process in more detail, let’s walk through an example:

  1. Automation Scheduling: The automation is scheduled to run every 15 minutes. The desktop agent is set up on a virtual machine to ensure it runs in unattended mode.
  2. Dummy Workflow Setup: A dummy workflow is created with fields such as “Request ID,” “Requester Name,” and “Approval Status.” Upon submission, an email is sent to the approver.
  3. Email Response Handling: The approver receives the email and responds with “Approve.” The automation script checks the email subject line and sender’s email address to validate the response.
    1. Invalid Response / Invalid Approver Handling: If the response is not valid or from an unauthorized approver, the system logs the incident and notifies the relevant parties for further investigation.
    2. Approver Handling: If the response is valid or from an authorized approver,  Workflow task will be approved.
    3. Rejection Scenario: If the approver responds with “Reject,” the workflow status is updated to “Rejected,” and an email notification is sent to the requester and other stakeholders.
  4. Workflow Update: The workflow status is updated to “Approved,” and an email notification is sent to the requester and other stakeholders.
  5. Sending Notification Emails: Email Notification to all stake holders involved.

Let's Deep dive above steps in Detail:

Step 1: Automation Scheduled as Background Job

In a real-time scenario, this automation can be scheduled as a background job at intervals of 15 minutes, 30 minutes, or any custom-defined time interval.

The frequency can be adjusted based on the volume of approval tasks. This scheduling ensures that the system checks for new approval requests regularly and processes them in a timely manner.

As mentioned in the first blog, it is mandatory to have the desktop agent running in unattended mode. This setup is crucial for ensuring that the automation runs smoothly without manual intervention.

For real-time business scenarios, we recommend installing the desktop agent on virtual machines to ensure continuous operation and to handle high volumes of approval tasks efficiently.

Job scheduling : SAP Build Process Automation

Step 2: (Optional) Triggering the Workflow -  Prepare the Dummy Workflow for Quick Testing

To facilitate quick testing, we prepared a small workflow using SAP Build Process Automation with a few fields. This dummy workflow simulates the real-time process and helps in validating the automation setup. Although in real-time, the workflow will be triggered via a valid application, here is a snapshot of our dummy workflow for demonstration purposes:

  • Workflow Trigger: Upon clicking the submit button, the workflow is triggered.
  • Email Notification: An email is sent to the approver for approval. This step involves configuring an SMTP outbound email, as mentioned in the previous blog post.

This setup allows us to test the end-to-end process in a controlled environment before deploying it in a live scenarioriggering the Workflow -  Prepare the Dummy Workflow for Quick Testing (Optional)

Test for Sending Email for Task Creation

Sample Email Body

Triggering Workflow : Testing Demonstrations:

Process Triggered and Sent for Approval

 Step 3: Handling Email Responses

Upon receiving the email, the approver will have three options: a) Approve b) Reject c) Not a valid response

Let’s say the approver starts with “ok” and responds with this in the email.

Upon receiving the response, our automation running as a background job will check if the response is coming from a valid approver and if the subject line is correct (the subject line should not be modified).

This validation step is crucial to ensure that only authorized responses are processed.

Validating Correct ApproverValidating Correct Approvers Response will be send if the Approver is not valid.

Response will be send if the Approver is not valid.

Validating Correct response: Validating Correct response

Step 4: Workflow Update on Approval

If the work item is approved, the workflow will move forward and update the task accordingly. This involves:

  • Updating the Workflow Status: The status of the workflow is updated to “Approved” in the system

Workflow Update on Approval

  • Notifying Stakeholders: All relevant stakeholders are notified about the approval via email.

Notifying Stakeholders

Workflow Update on Rejection

Similarly, if the response is “no” or “Rejected,” the work item will be updated, and the workflow will proceed with the rejected branch. This involves:

  • Updating the Workflow Status: The status of the workflow is updated to “Rejected” in the system.

Updating the Workflow Rejection Status

  • Notifying Stakeholders: All relevant stakeholders are notified about the rejection via email.

Step 5: Sending Notification Emails

An email notification will be sent to all involved parties to inform them of the status of the workflow request. This step ensures transparency and keeps everyone informed about the progress of the approval process.

rejection via email

We hope you enjoyed reading our blog series by me and @Adwait_Fadnavis  on Architecting Email Approval for SAP Build Process Automation Workflows. We trust that this approach provides valuable insights into managing workflow approvals efficiently without relying on manual My Inbox / Task Center approvals.

Thank you for following along with us.

Regards,

Mohit Bansal l, SAP BTP & S/4HANA Architect , Linkedin

entry.title: Situation Handling in Handling Unit Management In S/4 Hana
entry.content:
Hi Readers

Today I am here with new features in Handling Unit Management which is called situation handling. Here I will explain only conceptual knowledge for it. Please go through it and advise me to improve if it is required.

Brief Introduction to Handling Unit and its features

Handling Unit

A handling unit is a physical unit consisting of packaging materials and the goods contained on it. A handling unit is always a combination of materials and packaging materials

 

Nested Handling Unit

Handling units can be nested, and we can create a new handling unit from several other handling units.

 

Note- A handling unit has a unique, scannable identification number that we can construct according to industry standards such as GSI-128 or SSCC. For Example, Label Printing for EAN128 and Adapting the Label Layout.

We can use Handling Unit Management to map packing-controlled logistics in the SAP system. Here, we do not consider the movements of the individual materials, instead we map the movements of the handling unit  that contain these materials. Using handling units to map logistical processes simplifies processing of goods movements and thus optimizes logistics processes.

This simplified process includes the existing packing function in shipping and the storage unit processing in the Warehouse Management system, which have been enhanced here.

Some Handling Unit Features

  • A handling unit has a unique, scannable identification number that we can construct according to industry standards such as GSI-128 or SSCC.
  • The movability of the handling unit can be restricted if the quality inspection is active. Changes to the stock category as a result of a quality inspection are carried out through a transfer posting of the handling unit.
  • Reporting is available with which handling units can be found and displayed according to various selection criteria, such as material, packing instruction, or storage location.
  • Handling Unit Situation

Handling Unit Integration

Handling units can be used in all processes within the supply chain.

  • Sales and Distribution
  • Production
  • Purchasing
  • Goods receipt
  • Quality Management
  • Warehouse Management
  • Inventory Management
  • Shipping

 

Processes are supported

  • Goods Movements with Handling Units
  • Packing for Inbound and Outbound Deliveries
  • Handling Units in Production
  • Handling Units in Warehouse
  • Handling Units in Inventory Management
  • Physical Inventory management

Situation Handling Concept in Handling Unit in S/4 Hana

The consuming app is a business app for which this template is designed, and which displays a situation message. For some products shipped with handling units it is critical, that during the delivery certain basic conditions are met, for example, regarding the temperature, the humidity, or vibrations. To monitor these handling units, we can attach sensors to the handling unit before it leaves our warehouse to make sure that we get informed when defined thresholds are exceeded. The sensors send their data to a third party Internet of Things (IoT) system, which then creates a situation using the Handling Unit API to inform the shipping specialist. The person receives this notification, which leads to the relevant entry in the Monitor Handling Units (SAP S/4 Hana Cloud) or My situation (S/4 Hana on Premises) app. In the app, the shipping specialist can see, for example, which handling unit is affected and what the sensor detected. We can adapt the displayed texts to our own business purposes.

 Important Instruction-If a situation has been created for a specific handling unit and the situation has been resolved by the shipping specialist, no further situation can be triggered for the same handling unit. In the situation message displayed in the app, please consider the following:

  • The external handing unit number is displayed with leading zeros. If we copy the number, make sure to omit these leading zeros
  • The unit of measure is displayed as internal SAP code or ISO code only.

Role of Handling Unit IOT

Template used for Situation Handling that informs users about what is happening with a handling unit. The information is based on SAP Internet of Things sensor values, for example, an exceeded temperature or humidity value for a product packed in the handling unit that must be handled with care. We want your shipping specialists to be informed automatically when somethings happen to a handling unit.

How Handling Unit IOT works

 In SAP Internet of Things, we can configure sensors. Before a handling unit leaves your warehouse, we can attach these sensors to monitor your handling units. The sensors can,

For example, measure the temperature, the humidity, the force that is exerted on the unit, or vibrations. These values usually indicate that the goods could be damaged (because, for example, the temperature or humidity is too high, or the package was dropped).

Whenever these measured values exceed the threshold that we define in the rules, this information is sent back to SAP S/4HANA. In SAP S/4HANA, we can set up conditions to trigger a notification in the system. 

The shipping specialist receives this notification, which leads to the relevant entry in the Monitor Handling Units /My Situation app. In the app, the shipping specialist can see, for example, which handling unit is affected and what the sensor detected. You can adapt the displayed texts to your own business purposes. Since the shipping specialist receives this information as soon as the defined situation occurs, it is possible to react fast and immediately send a substitute product to the customer while the original delivery is still on the way. This saves time, reduces the risk of customer dissatisfaction while boosting your reputation as a reliable supplier.

Situation Display

 When situations occur, users are informed about them by various texts, such as in-app situation messages or notifications on SAP Fiori launchpad. In this section, we can see all preconfigured texts.

Conclusion - Situation handling is an alert for handling unit which can be sent to concerned team to spoil the product. It benefits to business and reduce the damages.

Reference https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/25a41481f62e469ba0e61015a0d39d20/4134bb536b13b44ce10000000a174cb4.html

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool vs. Tricentis Test Automation: A Comparative Analysis
entry.content:
Test automation is crucial for efficient implementation and maintenance of SAP landscapes. This article compares the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool (TAT) and Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) to help you choose the right tool for your business needs.

*** REMOVED BY MODERATION***

 

Overview

Feature

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool (TAT)

Tricentis Test Automation (TTA)

Availability

Pre-installed in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Quality Systems

Requires installation and integration with SAP Solution Manager

SAP Role Requirement

SAP_BR_TEST_ADMIN_AUTOMATION role

SAP Solution Manager user roles

Scope

Focused on SAP S/4HANA Cloud applications

Supports SAP on-premise and cloud products (e.g., Ariba, SuccessFactors)

Pre-built Test Scripts

330+ SAP-delivered automated scripts available

No pre-built scripts; users must create from scratch

API Testing

Limited to specific areas (Finance, Sales, Procurement, Manufacturing)

Supports all APIs

Post-Upgrade Testing

Supported

Not available

Supported UIs

Limited to SAP S/4HANA Cloud UIs

Supports a broad range of UIs (e.g., WebDynpro, GUI, UI5, mobile)

Integration with Non-SAP Systems

Not supported

Supports integration with non-SAP applications

Integration with Cloud ALM

Supported

Planned for future updates

 

Use Cases

Scenario

Recommendation

Focused solely on SAP S/4HANA Cloud

TAT is the best option

Complex integration with other SAP products

TTA is more suitable

Extensive API testing

TTA provides more flexibility

Regression testing for upgrades

TAT supports Post Upgrade Test (PUT) functionality

Integration with non-SAP applications

TTA is the ideal choice

Detailed Feature Comparison

  • Read full article *** REMOVED BY MODERATION***

Conclusion

Choosing between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool (TAT) and Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) depends on your organization’s testing scope, integration requirements, and automation needs. For simpler SAP S/4HANA Cloud-focused landscapes, TAT offers a streamlined solution with pre-built scripts and Post Upgrade Testing support. For diverse and complex environments, TTA’s flexibility and wide-ranging integration capabilities make it a powerful choice.

entry.title: Can a Free Chrome Extension Transform Your SAP S/4HANA Experience?
entry.content:
Hello folks,

in this blog post, I will explain the main functionalities of my Chrome browser extension. Although I am a software developer at SAP, this browser extension was developed in my free time. So it's not an official SAP product. But I'll promise it will work as smooth and with high quality, as if it was one 😎

So who can benefit from this browser extension? Basically all SAP S/4HANA user, so all customers, but also consultants who have to configure certain processes in the same fiori apps but different systems. As well as testers or developers who need to test their processes or features in different systems.

The design is kept in SAP UI5 (Fiori) style to have a smooth integration for new S/4 user but also experienced S/4 user. It should feel as one software to you.

What is the main purpose of this browser extension? Let's say you have 20 Fiori apps that you use frequently. Now you could of course just go ahead and create bookmarks in your browser, like you do for other web pages. But usually you will use these apps also in different systems, it could be a sandbox system, could be a Q-system and of course in your productive system. So if you have three systems, you would save 60 bookmarks. 

Using my browser extension, you create a "dynamic" bookmark which opens the Fiori app in any system. That means you come down to 20 "dynamic bookmarks". On top of that, you can save your most favorite systems as well.

You find the major features in this short clip that I recorded: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qu012cdXyFc

 

So where do you get the extension? In the official chrome store: https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/nelmoakcfgfgkigcjgkmibhmgfpbhcbh?utm_source=item-share-cb

 

After you have downloaded the extension and also pinned it in your browser, you should see the extension icon in your browser.

So let's get started now with our new Chrome extension. For that, we log in to a SAP S/4HANA system. I am using an internal test system.

 

Now we can add the S/4HANA System to our favorite list. For that we will click on the extension logo in our browser. It opens a popup, here we click on the 'Favorite' button in the top right corner.

 

A menu opens up, we can either add a Fiori app or an S/4 system to our favorite list. So we click on S/4 System.

Now we can decide how we want to name this new favorite system. In this example, we name it TEST/100. As we work on client 100 in that internal test system.

Now we save the S/4 System, by confirming and pressing save.

We open the 'Manage Bank Statements' app. And click again on the extension logo. We click again on 'Favorite'.

This time we click on 'Fiori App'. To add the current Fiori app to our favorites.

Fiori App name is already proposed as 'Manage Bank Statements' as have the Fiori app already on my favorite list, I change the name to "MBS DEMO". We click on 'save'.

 

If we right-click on the extension logo, we have an option to click on 'Options'.

 

Now the options page opens up. In the top left corner, we have three buttons (segmented buttons). With the labels 'Current', 'Tab', 'Window'. These are the same settings you do also see on the popover, which opens from the extension logo. These settings are the settings how you wish, to open the new S/4 system or Fiori app.

'Current' means it stays in the current browser and tab, and will navigate to it. 'Tab' means it will open the new site in a new tab. 'Window' means, accordingly, it will open in a new browser window. On the top right of the table you have actions, with which you can delete, edit or adjust the position of your favorite apps or systems. A bit below the three segmented buttons for the browser settings. You have two table tabs. One with 'Fiori Apps' and one with 'S/4 Systems' as label. With this, you can change the view on your favorite lists. On the bottom right you have an upload and download functionality. Keep in mind, you have to pre-select the correct table tab. You can't upload Fiori apps into your extension, when the S/4 Systems tab is selected, and vice versa.

 

The browser settings can also be found on the bottom left of your popover.

 

The system settings can be found on the bottom right. Whatever is selected here will the be only valid for your next navigation. Other than the browser settings which we have seen in the steps before.

Now we can navigate to a new app. By just clicking on our newly added favorite 'MBS DEMO'. The browser settings, are set that the new app will be open in a new window.

By the way, you also have the possibility to share your favorite fiori apps or systems with other colleagues. For that you open the options page of the extension and click on download, to download the fiori apps. You hand over the JSON file to your colleague, who can then click on "Upload" and import your list.

 

One small hidden gem: if you want to use the extension also in your incognito window, you have to enable this extension in your settings. 

Click on the three dots, then on Settings. 

Navigate to the Extension settings:

Almost there! Click on "Details".

Now click on the switch button to enable the extension also for the incognito mode:

 

Any further questions? Then please comment below. Feel free to share the extension to whoever might be interested.

 

More information about the extension can be found here.

 

Best,

Edrilan Berisha

entry.title: Unlocking the Power of Version Management in SAP Analytics Cloud for Planning
entry.content:
Version Management within SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for Planning is an area that needs to be organized and pristine.  This blog explores the differences between Private and Public versions and how to manage versions effectively using examples from best-practice business content, such as the Rapid FP&A Suite for SAP S/4HANA.

Understanding Private and Public Versions in SAP Analytics Cloud

Private Versions and Public Versions serve distinct purposes in SAP Analytics Cloud:

  • Private Versions are individual workspaces where planners can experiment with scenarios and updates without affecting others. Private Versions allow users to test different planning approaches in isolation.

  • Public Versions are shared, organization-wide Versions that serve as the official source of truth for FP&A data. When a planner inputs data into a Public Version, their inputs are captured in a Private Version. The planner must then actively choose to "publish" their changes so that they appear in the Public Version.

Establish a Single Planning Version

The process within the Rapid FP&A Suite uses a single, write-enabled, public PLAN version—the Working Plan—for all active planning activities. This approach minimizes confusion by avoiding multiple editable Plan Versions simultaneously. Multiple editable Versions (e.g., Plan_1, Plan_2) upfront, can:

  • Confuse planners about where to submit their data.

  • Require constant updates to input forms and associated security settings for each Version.

  • Introduce excessive variability into workflows, leading to errors.

To simplify the process, the SAP consultants behind Rapid FP&A suggest:

  • Focus on a Single PLAN Version: Using a single PLAN Version ensures planners always know where to input their data. This reduces confusion and eliminates the administrative burden of maintaining multiple editable Versions.

  • Pre-Configured Input Forms in Rapid FP&A: Input forms in the Rapid FP&A Suite are pre-configured to filter on the PLAN Version, ensuring planners work in the "Working Plan" Version.

  • Leverage Data Actions: The Rapid FP&A Suite includes pre-configured Data Actions that allow you to copy any PLAN data into finalized, version-specific names like Target2025 or Budget2024. Once copied, these versions become read-only and are naturally referred to by their specific names (e.g., Forecast2025) for clarity and consistency.

Why does this approach work? It focuses planners on completing one version of the Plan before moving to another, avoiding the complexity and errors of managing multiple editable versions simultaneously.

Managing Data Within Private Versions

Private Versions offer a flexible environment to refine and validate planning scenarios before publishing to Public Versions. Here are some best practices:

How to Use Private Versions Effectively

Planners must flow their plan inputs through Private Versions, regardless of how Public Versions are managed, so educating Planners on how to use Private Versions optimally is crucial. Proper use of Private Versions ensures accurate updates to the plan and provides  flexibility:

  • Experiment and Refine: Use Private Versions to model scenarios, refine your inputs, and validate changes without impacting others.

  • Publish with Purpose: Once all updates are finalized, publish the changes to the Public Version to make them available for organizational use. Under the Rapid FP&A Suite, published updates flow into the PLAN Version (Working Plan), which admins can later archive into specific Version names (e.g., Budget2026) once all plans are collected.

  • Utilize Tools for Confidence: Features like the “Revert” function and “Version History Panel” provide a safety net to undo mistakes during refinement of your Private version. Remember: Reverting is unavailable after publishing it in the Public Version.

Tip: The Rapid FP&A Suite includes pre-configured input forms and sample data, allowing you to practice updating and publishing Private Versions in a "practice" environment.

Best Practices for Managing Public Versions

Creating multiple specific Version names (e.g., Budget2026, Forecast2025) at the start of every planning cycle can be problematic. This approach requires updating all input forms and reports to align with each new Version name, creating inefficiencies and potential confusion. Additionally, frequent changes to Version names can leave users unsure where to input their plan data, causing unnecessary delays and errors.

Use Categories to Organize Your Versions

You can use the category property to organize your versions by type. Categories help distinguish versions and streamline management. The following categories can help organize versions:

  • Actual, Budget, Plan, Forecast, Rolling Forecast

A model can have one public Actuals version, typically updated via import from a data source like S/4HANA. However, private copies of this version can be created for analysis or testing. Categories like Forecast allow you to create multiple forecast versions to explore optimistic, baseline, or worst-case outcomes.

Under Best Practices in the Rapid FP&A Suite, planners will focus on one scenario at a time (e.g., baseline) within the PLAN Version. Once the scenario is finalized, it can be archived under a version-specific name such as Baseline2025 or Optimistic2025, and then the planner can move on to the following scenario. This approach ensures planners complete one scenario before moving to another, avoiding confusion and streamlining the process.

Hold Actual Data in a Read-Only Version

  • Store finalized Actual data in a read-only ACTUAL Version. This ensures the integrity of historical data and provides a clear baseline for variance analysis.

Archive Specific Versions for Reporting

  • Instead of constantly updating input forms and security for new write-enabled Versions, take snapshots of the working PLAN Version at key points in the planning cycle. Archive these snapshots into finalized, read-only Versions (e.g., Budget2026, Forecast2025) using pre-built Data Actions from the Rapid FP&A Suite.

  • This approach preserves the integrity of snapshot data while avoiding the repetitive task of reconfiguring templates and security for every user or group needing write access to a plan version.

How Rapid FP&A Suite Supports Version Management

The Rapid FP&A Suite for SAP S/4HANA is a valuable toolset for:

  1. Testing and Experimentation

    • Use sample data to explore how updates to Private Versions flow into Public Versions.

  2. Streamlined Workflows

    • Discover how we maintain a single write-enabled PLAN Version for all planning activities.

    • See how admins can create finalized, locked-down Versions efficiently by copying a version from PLAN

  3. Reducing Administrative Overhead

    • You will see how pre-configured input forms align with the active working PLAN Version.

    • With only one active PLAN version all the time, you simplify security and configuration management

  4. Preserving Data Integrity

    • Finalized Versions like Budget2026 or Forecast2025 are clearly labeled and locked for accurate reporting.

    • Any other interim snapshots of PLAN can be archived for reviews or status meetings.

Benefits for FP&A Teams?

  • Planners: Clarity on where to input data with a single active Version.

  • Admins: Efficiency in managing Versions with reduced maintenance effort.

  • Stakeholders: Reliable, finalized Versions ready for variance analysis and decision-making.

Getting Started

Ready to unlock the full potential of Version Management? Leverage the Rapid FP&A Suite for SAP S/4HANA as a toolset to test and refine your planning processes. Explore its pre-configured content, including input forms, data actions, and sample scenarios, to simplify and standardize your workflows. The best part? You can download the suite in minutes and review these processes using sample data—no integration is required during your discovery phase.

How do you Download the free Rapid FP&A Suite?
Downloading the Rapid FP&A Suite is straightforward and hassle-free.
Follow these steps to get started:
1. Log in to your SAP Analytics Cloud account.   Please don't use a production tenant.
2. Navigate to the "Content Network" on the left-hand side panel of SAC
3. Select "Business Content"
4. Search for "Rapid" in the upper right-hand 'Search' box - you should see Rapid Finance, Workforce, Sales
4. Follow the instructions to complete the download and installation of each of the Rapid modules (Rapid Finance, Rapid Sales, Rapid Workforce).

Let’s make planning Rapid, Simple, and Standard with SAP Analytics Cloud!
